bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 27, 1923

div1.p: Rose sends Carter clinical reports on possible yellow fever cases in Africa. The letter contains Carter's autograph notes. [Note: date may be in error; may be 1924, since enclosures sent with it date from March-Sept. 1923]

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 27, 1923
div1.opener:

February 27, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed copy of a letter
from Doctor A. Connal, of the Medical Research Insti-
tute, near Lagos, West Africa, enclosing reports enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3; enc. 4 of
two cases of yellow fever - Bradenelli and Wilson -
of which the first died and the second recovered
after treatment with Doctor Noguchi's yellow fever
serum. Doctor Connal also sent some autopsy material
which has been sent to Doctor Noguchi for his examina-
tion.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor H. R. Carter
Assistant Surgeon General
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
